question: Shenzhen Hua Xin Information Technology Co., Ltd. CES 2024 product highlight and specification

results.title: Company Profile - Kingxchip
results.content: Shenzhen Hua Xin Information Technology Co.,Ltd The headquarters of Huaxin is located in Shenzhen, there are R & D center and manufacturing base in Shenzhen and Sichuan. We are high-tech enterprises focusing on the field of intelligent cleaning robots.
results.raw_content:
Shenzhen Hua Xin Information Technology Co.,Ltd
The headquarters of Huaxin is located in Shenzhen, there are R & D center and manufacturing base in Shenzhen and Sichuan. We are high-tech enterprises focusing on the field of intelligent cleaning robots. We have a number of patented technologies in the industry and one of the first domestic enterprises to R&D and produce the sweeping robots. Our products are sold overseas and with a good reputation. Our markets cover Asia, Europe and the Americas etc. It covers more than 30 countries and regions around the world such as China, Japan, Australia, Germany, Italy, Brazil, etc. We provide innovative technologies and products for the home appliance brand owner, robot brand owner, and families, to let more families enjoy the ease, convenience, and happiness brought by technology. We are committed to building on the national artificial intelligence technology and to be the brand leader in this industry in the global market.
Own Brand “Tesvor” which is operated by our subsidiary Shenzhen Tian You Intelligence Co.,Ltd, After 5 years fast development, Tesvor already becomes top 3 brand on Amazon Germany, and successfully makes it’s robot vacuum product into Aldi, Vodafone, DNS etc. Physical Stores.
Production and Manufacturing
Our group has two production and manufacturing bases. The one has been put into use is located in Shenzhen which covers10000㎡, monthly output capacity reach 70,000pcs. Luzhou industrial park covers an area of 156mu, and factory has an area of 120,000㎡, monthly produce capacity can reach 250,000pcs.
OUR Principle
The principle of quality first and long-term strategic partnership with Epson, Nissan Nieder, Sharp Technology, BYD, Han’s Laser, Taiwan Yiguang, Qualcomm and other domestic and overseas chips, micro-motors, sensors, and other first-class suppliers. The production process is fully compliant with the requirements of the international ROHS environmental protection directive.
To achieve strong alliances with Haier, Gree, and overseas well-known brands. We provide ODM and OEM for first-line brands.
Technology Patents
As far, we have 36 invention and software copyright application technology patents (design, structure design, software programming, etc.) in the field of home robots, and we are applying for patents in the United States and Europe. Our product technology has always been at the forefront of sweeping robots. And have two global registered trademarks.

results.title: Huawei sells Honor brand to state-backed group · TechNode
results.content: Huawei is selling its budget smartphone unit Honor, the company said Tuesday, to a consortium that is majority-owned by the local Shenzhen government in a deal to keep the brand alive. Why it matters: The sale is a direct consequence of US technology export restrictions imposed on the Shenzhen-based company over the past year and a half.

Huawei sells Honor brand to state-backed group
Share this:
Every Wednesday and Friday, TechNode’s Briefing newsletter delivers a roundup of the most important news in China tech, straight to your inbox.
Huawei is selling its budget smartphone unit Honor, the company said Tuesday, to a consortium that is majority-owned by the local Shenzhen government in a deal to keep the brand alive.
Why it matters: The sale is a direct consequence of US technology export restrictions imposed on the Shenzhen-based company over the past year and a half. The world’s second-largest smartphone maker has lost access to most high-end semiconductors as well as Google apps and services on the Android operating system crucial to its handset offerings.
Details: Newly founded Shenzhen Zhixin New Information Technology will acquire all of the business assets of the Honor brand, according to a joint statement published in a local newspaper on Tuesday.
Context: Honor is a budget smartphone brand that Huawei established in 2013. It completes with other budget brands such as Xiaomi and Oppo while the Huawei brand sells to the high-end handset market.
